intro: Agrostophyllum philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine grass-leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
